text:
Hello! :slightly_smiling_face: :wave:
Had any of you have such problem with HubSpot hosted AMP blog posts? "A tag on this page requires an AMP component 'script' tag, which is missing."
In shows in Google Search Console
No problems for us, console says `Powered by AMP :zap: HTML – Version 2308112021001` . Maybe it's temporary?
Anyone experiencing HubSpot login issues? I keep getting logged out for some reason and generally page load is super slow for me

We are following the HubSpot Developer Docs to setup the <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/developer-reference/reverse-proxy-support|reverse proxy> and we are struggling with the initial steps.
When we try to register our domain in HubSpot, it identifies that we already have an SSL certificate "_It looks like this domain already has an SSL certificate from another provider"_, but when we try to verify our domain using the pre-provisioning link, instead of giving us a CNAME record and a TXT record, it gives us two TXT records, one of them being the ACME challenge, and therefore we cannot verify our domain.
Has anyone found a similar situation? Any idea on what could be wrong?
Question for the hive.
1. Is there a channel for powerautomate related endeavors?

2. Does anyone know if API access can only be granted if you have a non-trial (paid) account? I am the sole admin of an account I created for testing purposes, but the API doesn't appear to be letting me authenticate-
Oh I'm sorry I see there is a channel for API I'll take my question there
for whoever manages sequences in HubSpot
I have an email.
it's very pretty - I'm fond of it.
it uses a rich text contact property as a personalization token
it's very important the rich text renders the new lines
when I send the sequence manually
it does!
happy days.
when I enroll the contact in the sequence via a workflow
it doesn't
sad times.
my question: why?
it is the exact same sequence, same properties, same personalization token, same sender, same recipient, same text
but enrolling them into the sequence via a workflow action strips all line breaks from the rich text property
Does anyone know if there is a way to unenroll contacts from a sequence if their deal is set to lost?
Trigger by deal
Trigger by deal
If deal stage = any of {lost deal stages}
Then associated contact unenroll from sequence
IIRC
Ahhh nice, I'll look at this in the morning
let me know if you need more help :smile:
I just checked this and unfortunately I cannot find a workflow action that will allow me to do this. I have marketing enterprise, sales professional and ops professional
I'll take a look, if I don't get back to you tonight, please remind me

<@U04512YU6GH>
• Contact-based Workflow
    ◦ When Filter Criteria is Met Trigger
        ▪︎ Trigger Criteria
            • Deal Properties
                ◦ Deal Stage is {Name of Lost Deal Stage} AND
            • Contact Properties
                ◦ Now in Sequence is equal to True
        ▪︎ Action
            • Unenroll Contact From Sequence
Should look like this

Hello All!
I am facing an invalid date format issue when I create and update contact records using API (<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/contact/batch/>").
Please check the screenshot <https://capture.dropbox.com/6b52xWZyWPaI9hdI> and let me correct the format allowed in HubSpot using  API (<https://api.hubapi.com/contacts/v1/contact/batch/>").

Hello everyone
I have a query related to this API <https://api.hubapi.com/files/v3/files>.

I got the error "MISSING_SCOPES" while using this API <https://api.hubapi.com/files/v3/files>.

I checked the Auth token scope with this <https://api.hubapi.com/oauth/v1/access-tokens/{token}> and got the below response
{
    "token": "CP6Z-_xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxVZL7XtKA25hMVIAWgA",
    "user": "<mailto:akshay.dobariya@ajmerainfotech.com|x>xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx",
    "hub_domain": "<http://app.com|app.com>",
    "scopes": [
        "oauth",
        "files",
        "tickets",
        "files.ui_hidden.read"
    ],
    "hub_id": xxxx,
    "app_id": xxx,
    "expires_in": 1166,
    "user_id": xxxxxxxxxxxx,
    "token_type": "access"
}
